DataElement.preferredName: QC Slide Review Normal Tissue Segment Identifier Integer
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A number used to identify the normal tissue segment collected as part of the quality control review of the tumor biospecimen for proteomic and genomic analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: QC Slide Review Normal Tissue Segment Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Tissue Source Sites (TSS) will perform a QC review of tumor biospecimens by review of slides from corresponding FFPE QC blocks. For each tumor segment, an H&E-stained slide is to be prepared and reviewed by the TSS pathologist to confirm accuracy of tissue diagnosis and tumor composition._Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into one to three aliquots of non-neoplastic ("normal") adjacent tissue (as feasible) suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tissue Source Sites (TSS) will perform a QC review of tumor biospecimens by review of slides from corresponding FFPE QC blocks. For each tumor segment, an H&E-stained slide is to be prepared and reviewed by the TSS pathologist to confirm accuracy of tissue diagnosis and tumor composition.

Concepts.definition: Tissue Source Sites (TSS) will perform a QC review of tumor biospecimens by review of slides from corresponding FFPE QC blocks. For each tumor segment, an H&E-stained slide is to be prepared and reviewed by the TSS pathologist to confirm accuracy of tissue diagnosis and tumor composition.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into one to three aliquots of non-neoplastic ("normal") adjacent tissue (as feasible) suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample with cellular composition and architectural patterns expected for the particular anatomic site in which it belongs. There is no evidence of abnormal cellular infiltrates or tumor mass formation.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and Local Path CRFs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A positive number with no fractional part between 0 and 100.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

ValueDomain.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set.  8/7/19 jk created for CPTAC baseline CRFs.

DataElement.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElement.changeDescription: 8/17/21 jk added CM Path Rpt CSI. 7/12/21 jk added HNSCC Path Rpt CSI. 6/14/20 jk added CPTAC ESCA Pathology CSI.  4/30/20 jk added CPTAC LGG Path CSI.  4/17/20 jk def mod per SME review to support Slide Creation CRF; alt quest added for "Aliquot". 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/7/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and CRF; applicable to all tumor types.
